channel.title: R on Øystein Sørensen
channel.description: Recent content in R on Øystein Sørensen

item.title: Multilevel Semiparametric Latent Variable Modeling in R with "galamm"
item.description: This paper presents the R package "galamm", which contains open-source implementations for generalized additive latent and mixed models (GALAMMs). Published in Multivariate Behavioral Research.

item.title: galamm - Generalized Additive Latent and Mixed Models
item.description: This R package contains functions for estimating generalized additive latent and mixed models.

item.title: BayesianLaterality - Predict Brain Asymmetry Based on Handedness and Dichotic Listening
item.description: This R package contains functions for estimating whether a subject is left- or right-dominant for language processing based on the results of dichotic listening experiments and information about handedness.

item.title: BayesMallows: An R Package for the Bayesian Mallows Model
item.description: This paper presents the BayesMallows R package, for analysis of rank and preference data. Published in the R Journal.

item.title: metagam: Meta-Analysis of Generalized Additive Models
item.description: This R package contains functions for meta analysis using generalized additive (mixed) models, by combining fits from multiple studies.

item.title: hdme: High-Dimensional Regression with Measurement Error
item.description: This paper presents the hdme package, implementing variable selection methods for regression with covariate measurement error.

item.title: BayesMallows: Bayesian Preference Learning with the Mallows Rank Model
item.description: This R package contains functions for estimating the Bayesian Mallows model in a wide range of situation, using the Metropolis-Hastings algorithm.

item.title: hdme: High-Dimensional Regression with Measurement Error
item.description: This R package contains functions for fitting variable selection models in the presence of noise in the predictor variables. In particular, it supports a corrected lasso and the generalized matrix uncertainty selector. In addition, it offers an implementation of the (generalized) Dantzig selector.
